title: How to Deploy Cassandra-Based Applications on AWS
description:
In this video, DataStax dev rel engineer Aaron Ploetz details the necessary steps for deploying a Cassandra-driven application on Amazon's Elastic Container Service (ECS). Follow along as he shows how to leverage the Java version of DataStax's Data API, while building a Docker image for deployment. You'll also see how to deploy and run that image as a container on ECS, and watch as it pulls its data from a DataStax Enterprise (DSE) cluster running in the same Amazon region.

DSAlbums Github repo: https://github.com/aar0np/DSAlbums

Chapters
00:01:05 Expose the Data API service
00:03:12 Testing the Data API
00:04:43 Building the front end with Vaadin
00:06:50 Building the Spring Boot controller
00:14:16 Building the Docker image
00:18:50 Push the Docker image to AWS
00:24:08 Create a new ECS task definition
00:26:40 Create a new ECS service


Additional Resources:
- DataStax Developer Hub: https://dtsx.io/devhub
- DataStax Blog: https://dtsx.io/howto
- Try Langflow: https://dtsx.io/trylangflow
- Try Astra DB: https://dtsx.io/40kQpI6
____________________

Stay in touch:
- Join our Discord Community: https://discord.gg/datastax
- Follow us on X: https://x.com/DataStaxDevs
